awd_titl_txt: Collaborative Research: CI-SUSTAIN: StarExec: Cross-Community Infrastructure for Logic Solving
awd_abstract_narration:
StarExec is a web-accessed compute service that was developed (under a prior NSF grant) as a community resource/infrastructure to support researchers in the field of automatic theorem proving and other research areas that depend on logic-solving methods.  Research groups in these areas cannot support their own infrastructure due to the high cost of the hardware and the high degree of specialized expertise needed to run and optimize large-scale solver executions. StarExec users can upload solvers and benchmarks to the system, configure and execute jobs to run selected solvers on selected benchmarks, and collaborate by sharing data and artifacts.  The infrastructure was first developed to facilitate solver competitions and now supports a large number of users in many areas of research where logic solvers are used. 

This new grant sustains and expands StarExec by providing additional hardware (computing clusters) and human resources at the University of Iowa to meet the growing demand for this infrastructure, as the use of logic solvers expands to new research areas and larger-scale problems.  Part of the long-term, sustainability strategy is to create multiple instances of the StarExec software, starting with the University of Miami, which will serve as a demonstration and model for future expansion.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

por.por_cntn:
Logic solvers are computer programs that test large and complex logical formulas for validity. They are applied in domains ranging from computer science and engineering (e.g., software and hardware verification) to the arts and humanities (e.g., ethics and law).StarExec is a web service for evaluating and experimenting with logic solvers.It provides facilities for running solvers on a compute cluster, andviewing and exporting the results. StarExec serves over a dozen distinct different research communities, based on the particular kind of logical formulae. One particularly interesting use of StarExec is hosting many communities'annual solver competitions. The original StarExec service is hosted at the University of Iowa. This project created an instance of StarExec at the University ofMiami, focussed on supporting the Automated Theorem Proving (ATP) community that develops tools for solving problems expressed in (mainly) classical logic using the TPTP syntax.StarExec Miami is fulfilling a major need for high-quality, freely available compute infrastructure for scientific evaluation and comparison of different ATP systems. The creation of StarExec Miami has increased the scale and reliability, of evaluations that can be performed.Usage is significant, with almost 31 million experiments run since logging started in May 2019. StarExec Miami is a key piece of infrastructure in the ATP community, used by researchers and practitioners nationally and internationally.


Last Modified: 09/08/2021
Modified by: Geoffrey C Sutcliffe
por.por_txt_cntn:
Logic solvers are computer programs that test large and complex logical formulas for validity. They are applied in domains ranging from computer science and engineering (e.g., software and hardware verification) to the arts and humanities (e.g., ethics and law).StarExec is a web service for evaluating and experimenting with logic solvers.It provides facilities for running solvers on a compute cluster, andviewing and exporting the results. StarExec serves over a dozen distinct different research communities, based on the particular kind of logical formulae. One particularly interesting use of StarExec is hosting many communities'annual solver competitions. The original StarExec service is hosted at the University of Iowa. This project created an instance of StarExec at the University ofMiami, focussed on supporting the Automated Theorem Proving (ATP) community that develops tools for solving problems expressed in (mainly) classical logic using the TPTP syntax.StarExec Miami is fulfilling a major need for high-quality, freely available compute infrastructure for scientific evaluation and comparison of different ATP systems. The creation of StarExec Miami has increased the scale and reliability, of evaluations that can be performed.Usage is significant, with almost 31 million experiments run since logging started in May 2019. StarExec Miami is a key piece of infrastructure in the ATP community, used by researchers and practitioners nationally and internationally.
